About Yasca

Yasca is a multi-platform static analysis tool designed to help developers create high-quality, secure software. More information can be found at yasca.org.

Yasca Version: 3.0.5

The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the The username should never match the password.\r\n\r\nFor example, never use:\r\n\tfoo-username = bar\r\n\tfoo-password = bar\r\nor\r\n\tfoo-login = quux\r\n\tfoo-pass = quux","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak Credentials"},"lineNumber":7,"message":"\t$pass =$_POST['password'];","filename":"\/admin\/profile_update.php","unsafeSourceCode":["<?php session_start();","include('dbconnect.php');","","\t","\t$id=$_SESSION['staffid'];","\t$username =$_POST['username'];","\t$pass =$_POST['password'];","\t$old =$_POST['passwordold'];","\t","\t","\t","\t","\t","\t\t$query=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"select * from userlogin where staffid='$id' and password=SHA1('$old')\")or die(mysqli_error());","\t\t\t","\t\t\t\t$count=mysqli_num_rows($query);","\t\t\t\t","\t\t\t\tif ($count>0)","\t\t\t\t{","\t\t\t\t\tif ($pass<>\"\")"]},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/admin\/profile_update.php","lineNumber":14,"message":"\t\t$query=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"select * from userlogin where staffid='$id' and password=SHA1('$old')\")or die(mysqli_error());","unsafeSourceCode":{"4":"\t$id=$_SESSION['staffid'];","5":"\t$username =$_POST['username'];","6":"\t$pass =$_POST['password'];","7":"\t$old =$_POST['passwordold'];","8":"\t","9":"\t","10":"\t","11":"\t","12":"\t","13":"\t\t$query=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"select * from userlogin where staffid='$id' and password=SHA1('$old')\")or die(mysqli_error());","14":"\t\t\t","15":"\t\t\t\t$count=mysqli_num_rows($query);","16":"\t\t\t\t","17":"\t\t\t\tif ($count>0)","18":"\t\t\t\t{","19":"\t\t\t\t\tif ($pass<>\"\")","20":"\t\t\t\t\t{","21":"\t\t\t\t\t\tmysqli_query($dbcon,\"update userlogin set password=SHA1('$pass') where staffid='$id'\")or die(mysqli_error($dbcon));","22":"\t\t\t\t\t}","23":"\t\t\t\t\t"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/cid\/casedetails.php","lineNumber":45,"message":"\t\t\t \t\t$query=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"select * from complainant where case_id='$get_id'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"35":"\t\t\t <br \/>","36":"\t\t\t","37":"\t\t\t <div class=\"panel panel-success\">","38":"\t\t\t \t<div class=\"panel-heading\">","39":"\t\t\t \t\t","40":"\t\t\t \t\t<h3 class=\"panel-title\"> <span class=\"glyphicon glyphicon-user\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/span> Complainant Details<\/h3>","41":"\t\t\t \t<\/div>","42":"\t\t\t \t<div class=\"panel-body\">","43":"\t\t\t \t\t<?php","44":"\t\t\t \t\t$query=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"select * from complainant where case_id='$get_id'\");","45":"\t\twhile($row = mysqli_fetch_array($query)){","46":"\t\t\t?>","47":"\t\t\t \t\t\t <table class=\"table\">","48":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<tr>","49":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t\t<td>Case Number:<\/td><td><?php echo $get_id?><\/td>","50":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<\/tr>","51":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<tr>","52":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t\t<td>Name:<\/td><td><?php echo $row['comp_name']?><\/td>","53":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<\/tr>","54":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<tr>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the Scripting","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Cross_Site_Scripting":"OWASP: XSS Vulnerability","https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/XSS":"OWASP: XSS Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. ?>"}},{"severity":5,"category":"Local Time","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"Do not use local time values for comparison to each other, long term storage (database),\r\nor cache expirations. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of entropy).","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak Passwords","http:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/259.html":"CWE-259: Hard-Coded Password"},"filename":"\/cid\/profile.php","lineNumber":74,"message":" <input type=\"password\" Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session `assigned_date`, `status2`, `completed_date`, `id`) VALUES"}},{"severity":1,"category":"Weak Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/officer\/addcompl.php","lineNumber":21,"message":"$query1=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"SELECT * FROM case_table where DATE_FORMAT(date_added,'$today')='$today'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"11":"\t","12":"","13":" <?php include('menubar.php')?> ","14":"\t<?php ","15":"","16":"\t $date = date(\"Y m, d h:i a\");","17":"\t ","18":"$today=date(\"Y\/m\/d\",strtotime($date));","19":"","20":"$query1=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"SELECT * FROM case_table where DATE_FORMAT(date_added,'$today')='$today'\");","21":"\t$counter=mysqli_num_rows($query1);","22":"","23":" if ($counter==0)","24":" {","25":" $counter=101;","26":" }","27":" else","28":" {","29":" $counter=100+$counter+1;","30":" }"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/officer\/addcompl.php","lineNumber":155,"message":"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t$sql = mysqli_query($dbcon,\"select * from Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/officer\/casedetails.php","lineNumber":46,"message":"\t\t\t \t\t$query=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"select * from complainant where case_id='$get_id'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"36":"\t\t\t <br \/>","37":"\t\t\t","38":"\t\t\t <div class=\"panel panel-success\">","39":"\t\t\t \t<div class=\"panel-heading\">","40":"\t\t\t \t\t","41":"\t\t\t \t\t<h3 class=\"panel-title\"> <span class=\"glyphicon glyphicon-user\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/span> Complainant Details<\/h3>","42":"\t\t\t \t<\/div>","43":"\t\t\t \t<div class=\"panel-body\">","44":"\t\t\t \t\t<?php","45":"\t\t\t \t\t$query=mysqli_query($dbcon,\"select * from complainant where case_id='$get_id'\");","46":"\t\twhile($row = mysqli_fetch_array($query)){","47":"\t\t\t?>","48":"\t\t\t \t\t\t <table class=\"table\">","49":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<tr>","50":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t\t<td>Case Number:<\/td><td><?php echo $get_id?><\/td>","51":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<\/tr>","52":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<tr>","53":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t\t<td>Name:<\/td><td><?php echo $row['comp_name']?><\/td>","54":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<\/tr>","55":"\t\t\t \t\t\t \t<tr>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. ?>"}},{"severity":5,"category":"Local Time","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"Do not use local time values for comparison to each other, long term storage (database),\r\nor cache expirations. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session Expiration","https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/361.html":"CWE-361: Time and State","http:\/\/msdn.microsoft.com\/en-us\/library\/system.web.caching.cache.insert.aspx":"MSDN: ASP.NET Web Cache Insert","http:\/\/php.net\/manual\/en\/function.date-default-timezone-set.php":"PHP: Set Timezone"},"filename":"\/officer\/DB File\/ghpolice.sql","lineNumber":85,"message":" `time` timestamp NOT NULL DEFAULT current_timestamp() ON UPDATE current_timestamp()","unsafeSourceCode":{"75":"","76":"--","77":"-- Table structure for table `diary_action`","78":"--","79":"","80":"CREATE TABLE UPDATE current_timestamp()","85":") ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4;","86":"","87":"--","88":"-- Dumping data for table `diary_action`","89":"--","90":"","91":"INSERT INTO `diary_action` (`case_id`, `statement`, `id`, `time`) VALUES","92":"('60b8eba1d710f', 'This is the case', 2, '2021-06-03 14:48:12');","93":"","94":"--"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/officer\/deletecase.php","lineNumber":5,"message":"mysqli_query($dbcon,\"DELETE FROM case_table where case_id='$delete'\");","unsafeSourceCode":["<?php","include('dbconnect.php');","if (isset($_POST['delete'])){","\t$delete = mysqli_real_escape_string($dbcon,trim($_POST['deleted']));","mysqli_query($dbcon,\"DELETE FROM case_table where case_id='$delete'\");","mysqli_query($dbcon,\"DELETE FROM complainant where case_id='$delete'\");","","","header(\"location: caseview.php\");","}","?>"]},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. əmri","Hərtərəfli Kömək","Numpad 0","Vergül","Inside a dialog, press TAB to navigate to the next dialog element, press SHIFT+TAB to move to the previous dialog element, press ENTER to submit the dialog, press ESC to cancel the dialog. When a dialog has multiple tabs, the tab list can be reached either with ALT+F10 or with TAB as part of the dialog tabbing order. With tab list focused, move to the next and previous tab with RIGHT and LEFT ARROW, respectively.","Списъчно меню на редактора","Команди"," Access next focus space command","Left Arrow","F4","Editor de quadre de diàleg","Editor de menú contextual","Editor de barra de ruta de l'element","Ordre subratllat","Premi ${accessNextSpace} per accedir a l'enfocament d'espai més proper inabastable després del símbol d'intercalació, per exemple: dos elements HR adjacents. Repetiu la combinació de tecles per arribar a enfocaments d'espais distants.","Pàgina Avall","Multiplicació","Cometa Simple","Uvnitř dialogového okna stiskněte TAB pro přesunutí na další prvek okna, stiskněte SHIFT+TAB pro přesun na předchozí prvek okna, stiskněte ENTER pro odeslání dialogu, stiskněte ESC pro jeho zrušení. Pro dialogová okna, která mají mnoho karet stiskněte ALT+F10 pro zaměření seznamu karet, nebo TAB, pro posun podle pořadí karet.Při zaměření seznamu karet se můžete jimi posouvat pomocí ŠIPKY VPRAVO a VLEVO.","Rámeček seznamu editoru","Příkazy","Příkaz pro přístup k dalšímu prostoru zaměření","Escape","Numerická klávesa 8","Obrácené lomítko","Dewislen Cyd-destun y Golygydd","Blwch Rhestr y Golygydd","Gorchmynion","Ewch i'r gorchymyn blwch ffocws nesaf","Page Up","Divide","Inde i en dialogboks kan du, trykke på TAB for at navigere til næste element, trykke på SHIFT+TAB for at navigere til forrige element, trykke på ENTER for at afsende eller trykke på ESC for at lukke dialogboksen. Når en dialogboks har flere faner, fanelisten kan tilgås med ALT+F10 eller med TAB. Hvis fanelisten er i fokus kan du skifte til næste eller forrige tab, med højre- og venstre piltast.","Redaktør listeboks","Kommandoer","Gå til næste fokusmellemrum kommando","F1","Editordialog","Editor-Kontextmenü","Editor-Elementpfadleiste","Drücken Sie ${bold}","Zugang zum nächsten Fokus-Bereich","Feststell","Ziffernblock 8","Rückwärtsgewandter Schrägstrich","Dürcken Sie ${contextMenu} oder die Anwendungstaste um das Kontextmenü zu öffnen. Όταν ένας διάλογος έχει πολλαπλές παραγράφους, η λίστα των παραγράφων μπορεί να προσπεραστεί είτε με ALT+F10 είτε με TAB σαν μέρος της σειράς παραγράφων του διαλόγου. Με την λίστα των παραγράφων επιλεγμένη, προχωρήστε στην επόμενη και προηγούμενη παράγραφο με τα βέλη ΔΕΞΙΑ και ΑΡΙΣΤΕΡΑ, αντίστοιχα.","Αναδυόμενο Μενού Επεξεργαστή","Κουτί Λίστας Επεξεργαστών","Εντολές","Πρόσβαση στην επόμενη εντολή του χώρου εστίασης","Αριθμητικό πληκτρολόγιο 7","Ανάστροφη Κάθετος","Redaktildialogo","Kunteksta menuo de la redaktilo","Fallisto de la redaktilo","Komandoj","Komando por atingi la sekvan fokusan spacon","Eskapa klavo","Nombra Klavaro 8","Citilo","Editor de diálogo","Menú contextual del editor","Dentro de un cuadro de lista, mueva al siguiente elemento de lista con TAB O FLECHA ABAJO. Ireki uneko aukeraren azpi-menua ZURIUNEA edo SARTU edo ESKUIN-GEZIA erabiliz. Menuko aukera gurasora itzultzeko erabili ESC edo EZKER-GEZIA.
